result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric L Young

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court with Eric L Young.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.

Court vacates the stay warrant issued 10/12/2022.  Counsel informs court the defendant is homeless and sleeping in McArthur Square.  Counsel to meet with client to help him get registered.

Parties continue to work on resolution.  Defense request a plea and sentencing.  Court ordered the defendant to report to JusticePoint after court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant appeared late, around 11am, in person. Deputy provided next court date and advised the defendant that a Warrant will be issued if there is a non-appearance. 

Defendant acknowledged the information that was given.

Defendant Eric L Young not in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Eric L Young.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tufford in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant does not appear. Defense Counsel requests an imposed and stayed warrant. State objects due to the defendant's previous history of not complying with court orders. Court acknowledges the objection. Imposed and stayed warrant granted by the court. Matter is adjourned for a Calendar Call.
Calendar call scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric L Young in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
State's Witness was present. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 06.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 06.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric L Young in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Violation Report  received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Eric L Young in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Eric L Young in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Eric L Young appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Defense motioned to dismiss case due to lack of probable cause. Court denied motion. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
